obsinfo.obsMetadata package

obsinfo.obsMetadata.obsmetadata module

obsinfo information file routines, contained in superclass ObsMetadata for generality

class obsinfo.obsMetadata.obsmetadata.ObsMetadata(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: dict

  • kwars – dictionary of keyword arguments

convert_to_obsmetadata()

Make all contained dictionaries objects of :class: .ObsMetadata

get_configured_element(key, channel_modification={}, selected_configuration={}, default=None)

Substitute an ObsMetadata element with selected or modification values

This is the heart of obsinfo flexibility, which permits changes in configuration or even in individual attributes via channel modifications.

First converts any possible dictionary into an ObsMetadata object to be able to use this method recursively

Returns the value corresponding to key in the following way:

  1. If key present in channel_modification, return the corresponding value

  2. Else if key present in selected_configuration, return the corresponding value

  3. Else if key present in self, return the corresponding value

  4. Else if key not present in either, return default

Thus, channel_modifications override selected_configuration which overrides self (usually the attributes read from an information file, which, if not present, are substituted by a default.

Parameters

  • key (str) – key to values from the respective dictionaries

  • channel_modification (dict or ObsMetadata) – modifications specified at station level

  • selected_configuration (dict or ObsMetadata) – configuration specified at component level

  • default (str) – default value if none is found

read_json_yaml(format=None)

Reads a JSON or YAML file. Does NOT use jsonReference DEPRECATED.

DEPRECATED. Not being used by any obsinfo method or function. Kept for compatibility

Parameters

  • format (str) – format type, either “YAML” or “JSON”

Returns

Return type

(dict)

Raises

  • (JSONDecodeError) – problem with JSON read

  • (FileNotFoundError) – file not found

  • (IOError) – File input/output erre

read_json_yaml_ref(datapath, format=None)

Reads a JSON or YAML file using jsonReference

Like read_json_yaml_ref, but does not look for files in OBSINFO_DATAPATH $ref within the data files without absolute or relative path will be still looked for in OBSINFO_DATAPATH

  • datapath (Datapath) – object to store list of

  • dummy. (directories to search info files. Used as a) –

  • format (str) – format type, either “YAML” or “JSON”

validate(schema_path, filename, remote=False, format=None, type=None, verbose=False, schema_file=None, quiet=False, dp=None)

Validates a YAML or JSON file against schema

Parameters

  • schema_path (str) – schema path

  • filename (str or path-like) – name of file to validate

  • remote (bool) – whether to search for filename in a remote repository

  • format (str) – format of information file: “JSON” or “YAML”

  • type (str) – type of info file: “network”, “station”, “instrumentation”, “datalogger”, “preamplifier”, “sensor”, “stage”, “filter”

  • verbose (bool) – Print progression of validation steps with filenames

  • schema_file (str) – name of schema file

  • quiet (bool) – Deprecated. Conserved for compatibility. Cancels verbose.

  • dp (Datapath) – datapath for information files. If None, defaults to values stored in .obsinforc

If type and/or format are not provided, tries to figure them out from the filename, which should be “{TYPE}.{FORMAT}

validate_date()

Reformats an individual date

Uses regular expressions to match known dates, either in UTC date format, in UTC date and time format or in regular dd-mm-yyyy format. If only two digits of year specified, assumes 21st century. The separator can be either “/” or “-”

Parameters

date (str) – a date in a given format

Returns

a reformatted date as string or None if no value

Return type

(str)

Raises

(ValueError) if date is unrecognizable –
